pullRequest.body:
This PR fixes some `set_option maxHeartbeats` and all `set_option backwards._` situations. In these possible ways:
- writing the proof in a better way
- overwriting the default `aesop_cat` with a more efficient proof
- simply removing an unnecessary set_option.

This saves quite a bit of time.

closes #12534
closes #12535

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c493410d28](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20214/commits/c493410d28c2e680f5c0a8637fa5d8e60da58abd)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (4.17, 4.55)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1|-4|backwards compatibility flags|
|1417|-2|erw|
|11|-6|maxHeartBeats modifications|

Current commit [c493410d28](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c493410d28c2e680f5c0a8637fa5d8e60da58abd)
Reference commit [b1178f181d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b1178f181de6b53dfc90967c48c70fd5ac282e73)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench
The technical debt counter says that there is one more instance of `set_option.*backward` left. But that is in the file `technical-debt-metrics.sh` itself, so it doesn't really count

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7e5c3dfd-c3a2-4d13-b799-ffa730b4d68b) for commit 96dd697805d0d1211692ddeaf74abdef359dce56.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a400c7b9-9178-42db-b5a8-51c13bb81d50/to/7e5c3dfd-c3a2-4d13-b799-ffa730b4d68b) against commit 7d83d27ad7bfeb08a2d858ef8028e9f9d12f77db:
```diff
  Benchmark                                              Metric         Change
  ============================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.DifferentialObject           instructions   -71.4%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.BigOperators               instructions   -61.0%
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Functor.Flat                   instructions   -55.6%
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Mod_                  instructions   -90.6%
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Mon_                  instructions   -30.2%
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Triangulated.Functor           instructions    -7.0%
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.PresheafedSpace.Gluing   instructions    -4.7%
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.Order.DenselyOrdered                 instructions   -66.4%
```

It's not aesop that's to blame, but it is `simp`. The `aesop_cat` calls that I've replaced all spent most of their time on normalizing the goal with `simp`.

The problem seems to be that definitional equality is very time consuming to check for some definitions. Additionally, the goals that `simp` is used on may contain large proofs that it also tries to simplify.

maintainer merge?



> On the one hand these are all good changes, but I worry we're papering over issues that need to be fixed in aesop
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
It would good to merge master and confirm the improvements still exist/are necessary on the current toolchain.

Very nice! Just adding some more comments so this doesn't get undone, please.

bors d+

:v: JovanGerb can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
On the one hand these are all good changes, but I worry we're papering over issues that need to be fixed in aesop
On the one hand these are all good changes, but I worry we're papering over issues that need to be fixed in aesop
Proofs like this, which can be done by the auto_param, but are slow, need to have a comment added, or they will just get removed again.
Maybe a comment on these: "-- these work by the `auto_param` but are even slower"

pullRequest.title: chore: fix some slow maxHeartbeats and backwards compatibility flags
